Tunisia

Group G | Africa

Lablabi

Breakfast for dinner? Always a winner. It rhymes so it must be true. Also, with the time difference of this World Cup for some viewers, it might be a necessity for you.

Andrew Holman's chickpea soup is easily adapted with a variety of add-ons to fit your fancy. Your tastebuds will take off just like the The Eagles of Carthage want to from Group G.

  • Time 45mins
    plus overnight soaking
  • Makes 4
  • Difficulty Semi-Pro
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 150g Dried chickpeas
    1 cup
    150g
    Dried chickpeas
  • 4 tbsp Olive oil
    4 tbsp
    4 tbsp
    Olive oil
  • 1 Onion
    1
    1
    Onion diced
  • 4 cloves Garlic
    4 cloves
    4 cloves
    Garlic minced
  • 2 tsp Cumin seeds
    2 tsp
    2 tsp
    Cumin seeds
  • 2 tbsp Harissa
    2 tbsp
    2 tbsp
    Harissa
  • 1 Lemon
    1
    1
    Lemon juiced
  • 2 Eggs
    2
    2
    Eggs hard-boiled
  • 1 loaf Day-old bread
    1 loaf
    1 loaf
    Day-old bread ripped
  • 1 tsp Capers
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Capers
  • 1 tsp Green olives
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Green olives sliced
  • 1 tsp Parsley
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Parsley chopped
  • &frac12; Tomatoes
    ½
    ½
    Tomatoes roughly chopped
  • &frac14; Red onion
    ¼
    ¼
    Red onion sliced
  • 1 tsp Almonds
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Almonds Crushed
  • 1
    Wash the chickpeas in cold water and soak them in water overnight.
  • 2
    The next day, drain the chickpeas, place in a large pot or dutch oven and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook for 30 minutes.
  • 3
    When the chickpeas are soft, add the olive oil, onion, garlic, cumin, harissa paste, juice from half the lemon and season with salt. Simmer for 10 minutes.
  • 4
    While the broth is cooking, fill a small saucepan with water and bring to the boil. Cook the eggs for 7 minutes. If you prefer you eggs hard-boiled cook for 12 minutes instead.
  • 5
    Put big pieces of bread in the bottom of a bowl and laddle in the chickpea soup.
  • 6
    Garnish with the almonds, capers, olives, tomatoes, egg, parsley, red onion and slices of the other half of lemon.
